metadata.title: CVE-2023-31616 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue in the bif_mod component of openlink virtuoso-opensource v7.2.9allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via crafted SQLstatements.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvirtodbc0 - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
libvirtuoso5.5-cil - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-minimal - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-opensource - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-opensource-7 - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-opensource-7-bin - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-opensource-7-common - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-server - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-vad-bpel - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-vad-conductor - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-vad-demo - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-vad-isparql - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-vad-ods - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-vad-rdfmappers - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-vad-sparqldemo - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-vad-syncml - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-vad-tutorial - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
virtuoso-vsp-startpage - 7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: virtuoso-opensource package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.5.1+dfsg1-0.2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
